channel.title: USENET ftw
channel.description:
Normally I wouldn't start a topic about something I found that is fucking amazing (even though most of you already know about/use usenet) but in this case I had to. Basically ive been using bittorrent for a long time about 5 or 6 years and the first time I got a DCMA violation letter I started using a service called BTGuard which is a SOCKS5 proxy for bit-torrent clients. It cut my speed to about half but I was okay with this seeing that I wouldn't get another letter. Well I moved about a year ago and stopped using the service since I was with a new ISP but about a week ago I got another DCMA email and I was pretty mad (even though it really didnt mean shit). So I looked at BTGuard again and choose their VPN plan this time. Well it was shit and it cost 3 dollars more a month ($10) so I was looking at alternatives. Then I came across Usenet on a lifehacker guide and it led me to how to get started with usenet. So I bought a $10 a month plan from UseNetServer because it was highly rated and included SSL encryption. Then I bought a VIP membership to NZB matrix and started downloading.
All I can say is wow...ive known about usenet for a long time, about two years, and was really just too lazy to research into it, but it is maxing out my DL speed from my provider on every download I have completed. At first it was decently fast until I figured my ip was throttling it so I changed to the HTTPS port 443 and enabled SSL and it was blazing fast.
All the content I can find on bittorrent is on NZB matrix so im not missing bittorrent at all.
Anyways whats your guys view on usenet and how long have you been using it?

item.title: USENET ftw
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I meant to say DCMA email not letter my mistake.

Also another plus of USENET for me…my University blocks torrent traffic…I have no idea how to get around it I tried allowing only encrpyted connections and using port 80 or 443 which cant be blocked since thats http and https traffic but I still cant get a connection on any torrents…

But when I use a secure ssl connection with usenet and use port 443 I can download with full speeds over the university wireless, this is great! My university also doesn’t require verification to the wireless so I just use mac address cloning so they cant block my computer based on my bandwith usage associated with a certain mac address.

Read full topic

item.title: USENET ftw
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:12, topic:414371”]Idk if it’s my isp(Comcast) or what, but I’ve been torrenting for years at probably 20-150gb a month and I’ve never received one of those DCMA letters. I use tpb the majority of the time, and demonoid for the occasional thing tpb doesn’t have

What am I doing wrong?[/quote]Few people get DCMA letters.

Read full topic

item.title: USENET ftw
item.dc:creator: @soul_raever soul raever
item.description:
@soul_raever wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:5, topic:414371”][quote author=soul raever link=topic=516332.msg3747416#msg3747416 date=1315778958]
why does everyone always assume the only thing people use Usenet for is to pirate?
tsk
its “Newsgroups” for news…
[/quote]

You are joking right? Im sure the majority of activity on usenet is pirating.[/quote]

yea was kinda joking but still news is it’s intended purpose and there are some pretty good discussion boards around

Read full topic

item.title: USENET ftw
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:

Been praising usenet for some time already

item.title: USENET ftw

@Speljohan wrote:

You are correct, usenet is da bomb.

item.title: USENET ftw
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:7, topic:414371”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=516332.msg3747672#msg3747672 date=1315787663]
How does your search engine compare to this free one?
http://www.binsearch.info/

Also, what client do you use? I’ve found sabnzbd+ to be quite excellent, I still just use this free usenet server over IPv6:
newszilla6.xs4all.nl:119

Also you would probably never have torrent problems if you only accepted or made encrypted connections.
[/quote]

Hmm, looked at that site and I couldn’t fine what I was looking for. I think you would like NZBMatrix alot better you just type your search query, select a category and its basically right there. Best part is, is that it interfaces with sabnzbd+. If you wanna take a peek at it I can let you use my login information to try it out.

sabnzbd+ is what I use and I find it to work great and I love the interface. My ISP doesnt provide IPv6 so I cant use that but im pretty happy with that I have now even thought I have to pay for it.[/quote]

My ISP doesn’t provide IPv6 either, but Hurricane Electric does:
http://tunnelbroker.net/

Read full topic

item.title: USENET ftw
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:414371”]How does your search engine compare to this free one?
http://www.binsearch.info/

Also, what client do you use? I’ve found sabnzbd+ to be quite excellent, I still just use this free usenet server over IPv6:
newszilla6.xs4all.nl:119

Also you would probably never have torrent problems if you only accepted or made encrypted connections.[/quote]

Hmm, looked at that site and I couldn’t fine what I was looking for. I think you would like NZBMatrix alot better you just type your search query, select a category and its basically right there. Best part is, is that it interfaces with sabnzbd+. If you wanna take a peek at it I can let you use my login information to try it out.

sabnzbd+ is what I use and I find it to work great and I love the interface. My ISP doesnt provide IPv6 so I cant use that but im pretty happy with that I have now even thought I have to pay for it.

Read full topic

item.title: USENET ftw
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“soul raever, post:4, topic:414371”]why does everyone always assume the only thing people use Usenet for is to pirate?
tsk
its “Newsgroups” for news…[/quote]

You are joking right? Im sure the majority of activity on usenet is pirating.

cumescape:

Paying to pirate, etc.etc.

If I was only downloading 50 dollars or so worth of content a month it probably wouldn’t be worth it. But when im downloading 2-3 movies a day and a new game every week I think its a small price to pay compared to what I would be paying if I had to buy all that stuff legitimately.

item.title: USENET ftw
item.dc:creator: @soul_raever soul raever
item.description:
@soul_raever wrote:

well here in the UK i get Usenet access with my ISP free it’s not so bad the retention isn’t great but for the new releases its more than good enough but for older stuff i still have to rely on torrents
but yea Usenet is great especially if you have good retention as for how long I’ve been using it… about 3 years give or take

Read full topic
